course.subject: MGMT
course.name: Training and Development
course.description: In today's competitive business world, organizations need to implement training and development initiatives to continuously cultivate their human resources. This course aims to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of the training and developing process in organizations. Topics include training needs assessment, learning motivation, theories of learning, transfer of training, training methods, and training evaluation. The course will also examine special topics of interest such as cross-cultural training, career development, and the role of information technology and social responsibility in training and development.

reviews.author: nbslfg
reviews.title: Very practical MGMT course
reviews.comment_teaching:
Carmen is very kindhearted and enthusiastic. She remembers all of our names and tries to interact with us as much as possible.

Her teaching is on point. Every concept is followed by sufficient and vivid examples
reviews.comment_grading: I think the grading is relatively fair compared to other mgmt course. Participation part is huge since it's not hard to answer the questions raised if you pay attention in class. I screwed my exams but performed well in group project.
reviews.comment_workload:
Exam 1 @25%
Exam 2 @30%
Group Project (Workshop + Presentation) @30%
Participation @15%

Exams are non-cumulative and most questions open-ended. Fairly divided.

Group project includes holding a training workshop and a presentation afterwards. A lot of preparation work needed.

Participation is not challenging.

reviews.author: Kitty Leung
reviews.comment_content:
A class about training and learning.

Topic 1: Training needs assessment
Topic 2: Ensuring training motivation
Topic 3: Theories of learning
Topic 4: Transfer of training
Topic 5: Training methods
Topic 6: Evaluation of training effectiveness
Topic 7: Recent trends in training and development

Carmen will print handout so you can save some money and jot notes during class!
reviews.comment_teaching: Carmen is very funny and nice. She gives lots of examples and plays videos to let us familiarize with the concepts during class. She also speaks Cantonese style English so it is easy to understand. Sometimes she speaks quite fast, but she will stop when everyone is still writing. If you are absent with valid reason, you can email her for the lecture videos. She is very hardworking as well and she can finish marking within one week!
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation 15 points
Midterm 25 points (31/33; mean: 29; sd: 2.7)
Final 30 points (30/32; mean: 25.8, sd: 2.42)
Group project presentation 30 points (70/100; mean: 75; sd: 4)

A grade!
reviews.comment_workload:
Midterm and final are both open book open notes and both long questions Yet, the time is limited and there are lots of notes. So it is advised to revise thoroughly before exams! Also read and write faster!

Midterm covers topic 1 to 3. Final covers mainly topic 4 to 7. There will be a case for 3 questions. Both require you to give examples using the concepts so do understand everything before going for the exams.

Group project is consists of conducting a training workshop and presentation on the workshop with theories applied. 7 people in group by self-selection.
